metadata.title: CVE-2023-52450 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:perf/x86/intel/uncore: Fix NULL pointer dereference issue inupi_fill_topology() Get logical socket id instead of physical id indiscover_upi_topology() to avoid out-of-bound access on 'upi =&type->topology[nid][idx];' line that leads to NULL pointer dereference inupi_fill_topology()

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52450` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
linux-gcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
